#Draiocht - I know it used to be 'organised' but one could hardly count on the few labelled ids and ctrl-f is needed to find anything anyway, so I just
#merged everything together to more easily search, copy, and paste. Plus it was getting to a point where there were enough changes that is was 
#pointless to compare with vanilla anyway. Hope this doesn't mess with anyone's submod.

#Using this primarily for wet tropics with 'exotic' diseases
tropical = {
	1164 1165 1166 1167 1169 1170 1171 1172 1901 2948 2949 798 1168 1114  1117 1118 1119 1120 1121 1122 1124 1125 1126 1136 1137 1138 
	1139 1140 1141 1143 1144 1145 1146 1147 1149 1150 1151 1152 1153 1154 1155 1160 1161 1162 1163 1249 2238 2242 2248 2250 2252 2254 
	2256 2258 2266 2278 2280 2286 2290 2292 2294 2241 2249 2253 2255 2257 2267 2281 2283 2285 2289 2291 2293 2295 788 1183 1184 
	1185 1186 1187 1188 1189 1190 1191 1192 1195 1196 1197 1198 1199 1200 1201 1202 2950 2951 2952 4049 516 517 526 527 529 530 531 
	533 534 535 537 539 540 542 543 544 545 546 547 548 549 552 553 561 564 568 570 572 573 574 580 1946 1947 2026 2028 2029 2030 
	2033 2034 2036 2037 2038 2039 2041 2043 2048 2049 2050 2057 2080 2081 2083 2084 2089 2090 2091 2092 2099 2100 660 663 664 666 738 
	2155 2159 2160 2161 2162 2163 2164 2165 2166 1235 1236 1237 1238 1239 1240 1241 1242 1243 1244 1245 1792 1986 1987 1988 1989 1990

#Using this only for true deserts, generally with under 200mm or so annual precipitation, and with sand dunes or sun-baked rock

#Generally using this for areas around or above the tree line, with at least sporadic permafrost, average winter temperatures of at least -20C, and yearly mean temperature of at least sub zero
arctic = {
	1034 1035 1036 1037 1038 1039 1040 1041 1042 1043 1044 1045 1046 1047 1051 1052 1054 1055 1059 1061 1062 1064 1067 1068 1069
	1070 1071 1072 1073 1074 1075 1076 1077 1078 1080 1963 1964 2427 2425 2426 1780 2445 2428 2429 2433 2430 2432 2443 
	2431 2436 2442 2437 2435 2446 2438 2439 2440 998 999 1005 1006 2592 2574 676 705 2102 2128 2129 2134 1781 1782 
	1783  1787 1804 1805 1807 1811 1812 371 1104 1105 1777 315 2025 4205 4514 4515 4516 4518 4519 4520 
	4690 4691
	#4690 doesn't exist in vanilla but it creates a nicer border.
	
	#Beyond Typus New
	3111 3112 3113 3114 3119 3284 3285 4129 677 2130 1810 4924 4925 4968 4969 4970 4971 4928 4930 4932 4933 4977 4976 
	4978 4980 4985 4990 4991 4992 4993 4994 4995 4996 4997 4998 5006 5007 4999 5123 5120 4983 4986 4989 4987 2599 5001 
	2595 5002 5040 5041 4934 4929 4931 4937 5015 5008 5009 5010 5011 5014 4923 
	2575 5012 997 5093 5067 5068 5069 5070 5071 5072 5073 5074 5075 5076 5077 5078 5079 5588 5589 5590 5591
	1962 5592 5593 5594 5595 5596 5650 5673 5674 5675 5676 5677 5678 305 4257 5722 5080 5081 5082 5084 5899 5911 
	5912 5913 5914 5915 5916 5917 5918 5919 8000 8001 8002 8003 8004 8005 8006 8007 8008 8009 8010 8011 8012 4935 5083 
	5087 5573 5587 5639 5580 5641 1806 5003 2594 4151 8545 
	
	#Iffy NA borderline subarctic I've changed over 5 times already
	#1000 1003 5003 5005 1806 2594 5055 2577 2576 996 
	#21 11 18
}

#Generally places with accumulating snowpack, severe winter storms, and average winter temperatures well under 0C
severe_winter = {
	10 11 18 19 20 21 30 31 32 33 73 165 166 1768 1870 1871 1873 293 294 295 296 297 298 299 300 301 302 303 304 305 306 307 308 
	309 310 311 312 313 314 315 1752 1753 1754 1755 1776 1777 1778 2408 2102 2103 1048 2420 2415 2749 371 1104 1105 452 458
	554 557 565 1788 2070 2073 2074 2071 1034 1035 1036 1037 1038 1039 1040 1041 1042 1043 1044 1045 1046 1047 1051 1052 1054 1055 1059 
	1061 1062 1064 1067 1068 1069 1070 1071 1072 1073 1074 1075 1076 1077 1078 1079 1080 1081 1082 1083 2418 2419 2421 2422 2423 2425 
	1780 2426 2427 2428 2429 2433 2445 2432 2443 2430 2431 2436 2437 2442 2435 2446 2438 2439 2440 422 462 1856 460 716 718 719 724 727 
	729 731 1049 1066 1053 1058 2104 2105 2107 2127 2185 2186 2189 677 2130 977 978 904 906 907 908 909 910 911 912 945 990 991 992 986

impassable = {
	#1700s and 1800s Vanilla wastelands
	1779 1781 1782 1783 1784 1785 1786 1787 1788 1789 1790 1791 1793 1794 1795 1796 1797 1798 1799 1801 1802 1803 1804 1807 1814 
	#Other Vanilla wastelands
	1173 1950 2194 2200 2251 2334 2426 2740 2936 
	#Vanilla RNW provinces apparently set aside for wastelands -This will need some work if ever overhauling TOT projection for RNW
	3590 3591 3592 3593 3594 3595 3596 3597 3598 3599 3620 3621 3622 3623 3624 3625 3626 3427 3628 3629 3630 3631 3632 3633 3634 3635 3636 3437 3638 3639
	#1.19 wastelands (plus 5118, 5119, and 5121)
	4146 4154 4156 4157 4159 4160 4161 4162 4167 4179 5118 4763 5121 5124 5125 5126 
	#1.19 cut wastelands
	#4153			Scandes, 2000m... wow... Not even glacier covered at the 67th parallel... This is barely a hill, and no worse than most of Lappland
	#4155			Carpathians, controversial, but I've seen nothing to convince me these are any other than hills. Sorry to the dozens of people this will anger....
	#4169			Aures, seriously... a warm 2400m as wasteland? While we're at it, lets make everything outside of N France and N Italy wasteland
	#4170			Zagros, Tough call, exceeds 4000m, but also appear to have been crossed and settled due to latitude and weather. Might rethink this when overhaul makes it here
	#4172			Zagros2, Tough call, exceeds 4000m, but also appear to have been crossed and settled due to latitude and weather. Might rethink this when overhaul makes it here
	#4177			Elburz, Very tough call. 5000m plus, but latitude, weather, & passes prompt me to say no wasteland. Might rethink this when overhaul makes it here
	#4178			Pontic Mountains, Another tough call but low latitude, mild weather and under 4000m, mostly forested, no glacier coverage, regularly crossed by traders and armies.... cutting it
	
	4168 4569     #1.28 new wasteland
	
	1913	#Northern Rockies, still a wasteland for now - maybe always
	4400 4401 4402 4403 4522 2129			#Indian Wastelands in 1.26. Leaving them all intacted for now.
	
	4140			#Ran into some weird and very rare bugs with units getting stuck off the map by somehow getting to these (cut vanilla) provinces. Hopefully making them wastelands will fix this -note probably event spawned troops, if I had to guess... oh well, this is a cheap fix but should be effective
	
	7103 7116 7121 7713 7719 7720 7742 7153 5865 			#Cut some provinces in 11.5, so I'm adding them here just as a contingency to prevent any related oddities.
	
	#BTP provinces replaced by new 1.16, 1.19, and 1.22 Paradox province ids, added to wastelands as a redundancy, but probably not needed
